column1: # Viscosity profile averaged over time from
# Pressure-Driven Poiseuille Flow: A Major Component of the Torque-Balance Governing Pacific Plate Motion
# This profile has been cut off from below at roughly 5e20 Pa s in the asthenosphere.
# Note: This is a mean profile. Therefore is should not be used for mantle convection simulations with a Frank–Kamenetskii type 1 ( see ExponentialViscosity class ) viscosity.
# Using this as a baseline viscosity for a Frank–Kamenetskii type 2 ( see ExponentialViscosity class ) or Arrhenius type viscosity might be a valid use case.
